episode_title: 511 - The One With All The Resolutions

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Rachel are hosting a New Year’s party. So the place is crowded and in a shameless promotion for NBC they’re watching Jay Leno’s coverage of New Year’s from Time Square.

content.speaker: Jay Leno
content.text: Is there any entertainment there? What are people doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! Here we go! 1999! The year of Joey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’re very happy for you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s the matter?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We wanted to kiss at midnight, but nobody else is going to so y’know…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, I’ll take care of it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no, wait! Joey!
(They try to stop him, not sure of what he’s planning. He ignores them and goes to talk to Ross.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross! Ross! Ross, listen! Who are you kissing at midnight, huh? Rachel or Phoebe?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well you gotta kiss someone, you can’t kiss your sister.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, who’s gonna kiss my sister.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Awww, man! Really?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude-dude, who would you rather have kiss your sister, me or Chandler?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s a good point.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh well, since I have that whole history with Rachel, I guess Phoebe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, great!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs! Pheebs! Ross wants to kiss you at midnight!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s so obvious, why doesn’t he just ask?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rach! Rach! Listen, I’m gonna kiss you at midnight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, everyone’s gotta kiss someone. You can’t kiss Ross you got the history.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So? Who would you rather have kiss you, me or Chandler?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, good point.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: All
content.text: 3! 2! 1! HAPPY NEW YEAR !!
(And with that everyone starts playing tonsil hockey. Chandler with Monica, Ross with Phoebe, and Joey with Rachel.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Happy New Year!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Happy New Year.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Happy New Year, Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You too!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Happy New Year, Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So did that do anything for ya?
(Rachel slowly walks away.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, after the party. Everyone has left, except for the gang.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? I’m gonna go out on a limb and say no divorces in ‘99!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But your divorce isn’t even final yet.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just the one divorce in ‘99! Y’know what, I am gonna be happy this year. I am gonna make myself happy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you want us to leave the room, or?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Everyday I am gonna do one thing that I haven’t done before. That my friends is my New Year’s resolution.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh! That’s a good one! Mine is to pilot a commercial jet.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s good one too, Pheebs. Now all you have to do is find a planeload of people who’s resolution is to plummet to their deaths.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe your resolution is to not make fun of your friends, especially the ones who may soon be flying you to Europe for free on their own plane.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She has a better chance of sprouting wings and flying up your nose than you do of not making fun of us.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: In fact, I’ll bet you 50 bucks that you can’t go the whole year without making fun of us. Eh, y’know what, better yet? A week.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll take that bet my friend. And you know what, paying me the 50 bucks could be the “new thing you do that day!” (Ross looks at him.) And it starts right now!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, my New Year’s resolution is to learn how to play the guitar.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?! How come?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, y’know those special skills I have listed on my resume? I would love it would be great if one of those was true.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Do you want me to teach you? I’m a great teacher.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really? Who-who have you taught?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I taught me and I love me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah that’d be great! Thanks Pheebs!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Op, look! Claire forgot her glasses! And she’s gonna be really needing these to keep an eye on that boyfriend, who, I hear, needs to keep his stapler in his desk drawer, if you know what I’m talking about.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Rach, maybe your resolution should be to umm, gossip less.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t gossip!
(They all laugh.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, maybe sometimes I find out things or I hear something and I pass that information on y’know kinda like a public service, it doesn’t mean I’m a gossip. I mean, would you call Ted Kopel a gossip?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well if Ted Kopel talked about his coworkers botched boob jobs, I would.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? They were like this!
(She puts her hands over her breasts and indicates that the coworkers boob job resulted in one pointing up and one pointing down with her hands by pointing up with one hand and down with the other.)

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is talking to a beautiful woman as Chandler and Joey enter.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: I’ll see you tomorrow.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay! (She leaves.) (To Chandler and Joey.) Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just asked that girl out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nice!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nice!! Yeah! Is that part of your resolution, your new thing for today?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes it is. See. (Shows them the piece of paper she gave him with her name and phone number on it.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Elizabeth Hornswoggle?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right, uh, Elizabeth Hornswoggle.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Horn-swoggle.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You all right Chandler? Is there something funny about that name?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. No, I just think that maybe I-I’d heard it somewhere before. (Sits down rubbing his temple.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh really! Where? Somewhere funny I’d bet! (Chandler is straining to keep quiet as Phoebe enters.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi, Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-oh, guess what? I-I have a date with Elizabeth (Talking into Chandler’s ear.) Hornswoggle.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hornswoggle? (To Chandler) Ooh, this must be killing you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, see you later.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See ya! All right Pheebs, I am ready for my first lesson.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (Joey tries to take the guitar.) Oh no-no-no, you don’t touch the guitar! First you learn here, (Points to her head.) then you learn here. (Points to the guitar.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Umm, okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, lesson one: chords. Now, I don’t know the actual names of the chords but umm, I-I-I made up names for the way my hand looks while I’m doing them. (She starts to show Joey the chords. Transcribers Note: For this one you’ll have to use your imagination, ’cause it would take me 50 pages to describe each one. So if you want to see them, you’ll have to wait for this episode to come to a TV near you.) (Holding up her hand and then reconfiguring her hand with each name.) So then, this is Bear Claw. Okay, umm, Turkey Leg and Old Lady. (Joey tries to imitate them.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What an interesting approach to guitar instruction. Y’know some might find it amusing, I myself find it regular.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is entering with Rachel.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey everybody, Rachel was so good today. She didn’t gossip at all.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I didn’t! Even when I found out…umm, all right, well let’s just say I found something out something about someone and let’s just say she’s gonna keep it. (Goes into her room.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Pheebs! Check-check this out. (Holds up his hand in one of Phoebe’s chords.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, you nailed the Old Lady! (They both laugh at what she said.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah listen so, I thought I was getting better, so on my way home today I stopped by this guitar store and…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Did you, did you touch any of the guitars while you were there? Did you?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Give me your hands. (He does and she smells his left hand.) Strings. Gimme it! (He gives her his right hand and she smells it as well.) Pick. Do you want to learn to play guitar?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Then don’t touch one!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi Ben!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Auntie Monica!! (He runs to hug her.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross is wearing leather pants! Does nobody else see that Ross is wearing leather pants? (Pause, no one speaks.) Someone comment on the pants!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I think they’re very nice.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I like ’em.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! (Chandler bangs the table in frustration.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I like them a lot.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s not what I had in mind! See, people like Ross don’t generally wear these types of pants. You see, they’re very tight. (Motions to Ross’s buttock.) Maybe there’s something in that area.
(They all speak at once in general approval of his pants selection; Joey asks where he got them. I can’t pick out the rest of it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh see, I-I needed a new thing for today and there’s this leather store that always smells so good and I thought to myself, “Wow, (To Chandler) I never really owned a good smelling pair of pants before.”
(No one says anything.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh come on!! (Storms out.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, seriously, what do you think?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You look like a freak.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Awful, absolutely awful. (Plus other negative comments from Phoebe and Monica.)
(Monica starts taking pictures of Ross and Ben, with the flash.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you, what are you doing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s my New Year’s resolution!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, to blind my child?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! To take more pictures of all of us together. I mean I really think it’s the best resolution because everyone will enjoy the pictures.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, everyone will enjoy my music as well. (Does a chord and Monica starts taking pictures of him and Phoebe. They both start to strike a pose with the excessive amount of pictures that Monica takes.)

content.description: Elizabeth Hornswoggle’s apartment; Ross is there on his date with her. They are sitting on the couch watching a movie. Ross is obviously hot.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My God! These pants are burning up! (He’s still wearing the leather pants.) (She snuggles closer.) Oh come on, she wants to snuggle now! What is she trying to kill me? It’s like a volcano in here! (Out loud.) Are you hot?

content.speaker: Elizabeth Hornswoggle
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, it must just be me then.

(He shifts on the couch and a ripping sound emanates from his lower regions, the sound reminds one of a brief explosion of gas. In other words, it sounds like he farted. She has a look of horrific wonderment, wondering “Did he just fart?”)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That was just the pants on the couch. Umm, hey, do you, do you mind if I use your bathroom?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: No, go ahead.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks. (Gets up and as he does so, the sound returns. Without another word he heads into her bathroom.)

[Cut to Elizabeth Hornswoggle’s bathroom, Ross frantically pulls his shirt out and drops his pants. He exhales in sheer ecstasy as the coolness of the bathroom envelops his legs. He sits on the cast iron bathtub, again gasping in pleasure. He next grabs a magazine and starts to blow air on his exposed legs, but that doesn’t work the way he wants it to. So he throws the magazine down, looks around for another idea, and finds one. He jumps up and hops to the sink. He turns on the water and starts to splash some on his legs, cooling them further.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhh………

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Hey, my favorite part is coming up!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ’kay!
(He goes to pull up his pants, but can’t seem to get them past his knees. He frantically tries to pull them up to no avail. Panic sets in.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is drilling Joey on the chords as Monica looks on.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Tiger! (Joey moves his hand in an attempt to do the chord, in fact he does it with each name.) Dragon! Iceberg!! (He fails.) Joseph, did you even study at all last night?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes! Yes, I did.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Then do Iceberg!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: (quietly) G-sharp.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: G -sharp? Have you been studying the real names of the chords? (Joey doesn’t answer.) Have you? (He looks away in shame.) Oh my God!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?! I didn’t touch a guitar!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, but you’re questioning my method!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I’m not questioning it, I’m saying it’s stupid! (Notices Monica standing between them and smiling.) What?! (The camera clicks, taking another picture.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you. (Leaves.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know none of my other student thought I was stupid.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Your other student, was you!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, well, y’know maybe you just need to try a little harder!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, maybe I need to try a real teacher! Right here! Here! Andy Cooper, he teaches guitar and look ooh, there’s a nice picture of him with a little kid and THE KID’s GOT A GUITAR!!!!!! (Storms out.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine! You go learn from your qualified instructor! But don’t come crying to me when everyone’s sick and tired of hearing you play Bad, Bad Leroy Brown !!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: “Baddest man in the whole damn town.”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, fine! Take his side! (Storms out.)

(Rachel looks shocked, gets over it, notices she’s alone, and picks up the phone. The last part of which is something she shouldn’t have done, because the phone is already in use. By Monica, and now Rachel can hear every word.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t wait to be with you! I’ll sneak over as soon as Ross picks up Ben. I’ll just tell Rachel I’m gonna be doing laundry for a couple of hours.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Laundry. Huh. Is that my new nickname? (Rachel is absolutely stunned, she opens her mouth in absolute amazement.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Awww, y’know what your nickname is, Mr. Big…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Arghh!! (She quickly hangs up the phone and starts to pace around wondering what to do.)

content.description: Chandler, Joey, and Ross’s, The phone rings and Joey answers it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, it’s Ross! I need some help!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, Chandler’s not here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, you can help me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Listen, I’m in Elizabeth’s bathroom…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nice!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I-I got really hot in my leather pants so I took them off but they must have shrunk from the-the sweat or-or-or my legs expanded from the heat. Look, I-I can’t put them back on. I can’t!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. That is quite a situation. Uh, do you see any like, powder?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Powder! Yeah! Yeah, I have powder! (Grabs some of her shelf.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good-good, okay, sprinkle some of that on your legs, it’ll absorb some of the moisture and then you can get your pants back up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, okay, hold on! (He puts the phone down and proceeds to spread a large amount of powder on his legs and makes another attempt at pulling up his pants. It doesn’t work, and without picking up the phone leans down to it.) (Almost in tears.) They’re not coming on man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Umm, do you see any—oh, Vaseline ?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh, I-I see lotion, I have lotion! Will that work?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, sure, spread some of that on there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hold on.

(Ross proceeds to apply copious amounts of the lotion on his legs. He literally starts spraying the back of his legs with the lotion, and as he applies some to his butt he makes a happy face like he enjoyed that sensation. After using about half the bottle he again tries to pull up his pants, but at the first sign of resistance, his hand slips off of the pants and hits him in the forehead.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross? You okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: They’re still, they’re still not coming on man and the lotion and the powder have made a paste!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?! Uhh, what color is it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What difference does that make?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I’m just—if the paste matches the pants, you can make yourself a pair of paste pants and she won’t know the difference!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, do you have a minute?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dude, what am I gonna…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, Rachel’s here, so good luck man, let me know how it works out. (He hangs up the phone and strands Ross in the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Joey, I have such a problem!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh well, you’re timing couldn’t be better. I am putting out fires all over the place.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Okay. Okay. Joey, I have got to tell you something!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What-what is it, what is it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, it’s so huge, but you just have to promise me that you cannot tell anyone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no, no-no-no-no! I don’t want to know!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! Yes! Yes, you do want to know! This is unbelievable!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t care, Rach! Look, I am tired of being the guy who knows all the secrets but can’t tell anyone!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? What secrets? You know secrets? What are they?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And you’re not supposed to be gossiping!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, I know! I just can’t keep this one in, so I pick up the phone… (Joey in a childish attempt to not hear what Rachel is about to say, puts his fingers in his ears and starts to scream loudly. Rachel turns and walks out upon seeing that Joey’s not gonna listen, and as she exits Chandler walks in and sees Joey in his current state.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m not listening to you!

(Chandler seeing that Joey has his eyes closed sneaks over and picks up the chicken. The chicken starts flapping it’s wings in protest as Chandler holds the chicken inches from Joey’s face. Joey stops yelling and upon opening his eyes sees the chicken, screams, and falls to the ground in horror.)

content.description: Elizabeth’s apartment; Elizabeth is inquiring as to the delay in Ross’s exit from her bathroom.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Ross, umm, you’ve been in there for a long time. I’m starting to get kinda freaked out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, I’m coming out. Hey, can you turn the lights off.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: No, let’s just leave the lights on.

(Ross opens the door and steps into the living room. He has fully removed his pants and holds them wrapped into a ball in front of his crotch. His legs are covered in the powder and lotion paste. He looks terrible.)

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I had a problem.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is there to apologize to Phoebe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I can’t talk to you! I don’t have a fancy ad in the Yellow Pages!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, Pheebs, I just, I wanna apologize for, for saying that your method was stupid and-and maybe ask you to be my teacher again. And-and I promise, I won’t touch a guitar until you say I’m ready. (After a short pause she hands him her guitar.) You really think I’m ready?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! Cool! (He takes the guitar, stands up, and goes to play a note. However, while strumming it, he knocks it out of his hands and it bounces off the table and lands on the floor. Phoebe just stares at the guitar.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Was the chord at least right…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross is returning from his horrible trek back home without pants on. The whole gang is there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We heard about your pants, I’m so sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This year was supposed to be great! But, it’s only the second day and I’m a loser with stupid leather pants that don’t even fit!

content.speaker: All
content.text: No. No, you’re not a loser.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look at me! (Chandler squeaks in an attempt not to make fun of him.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, hey, look. Look Ross, Ben drew a picture of you! (Shows him Ben’s picture.) Huh? You’re-you’re a cowboy!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, be-because of the leather pants.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: See? Ben doesn’t think you’re a loser, he thinks you’re a cowboy! Now that’s something.
(All at once.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That really is something; that’s really cool.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Howdy partner!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Maybe I should get another pair! Ooh, y’know, they-they had some with fringe all down the sides. (Chandler starts rubbing his temple again.) I’m gonna go kiss Ben goodnight. (He starts to head for Monica’s bedroom.) I can’t believe he thinks I’m a cowboy. (Pause.) I would make a good cowboy. (He struts into Monica’s room.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, now that everything’s wrapped up here, I think I’m, I’m gonna go do my laundry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, me too. Y’know if this shirt is dirty. (Smells it.) Yep.
(They both exit.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I’m gonna go too. I’m gonna go to the airport. I figure if I hang around there long enough, someone’s bound to leave one of those planes unattended.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good luck, honey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bye! (She exits, leaving Rachel and Joey alone.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, uh, Joey?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Umm?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Remember that big thing I was gonna tell you about?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, no! (Starts that screaming thing again. Rachel stops him by pulling his fingers out of his ears.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not gonna tell you, but if you found out on your own, that would be okay and then we could talk about it. Right?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, then it wouldn’t be a secret. So yeah, that would be okay. Yeah. Yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Well. (Pause.) Hey uh Joe, would mind going over to Chandler’s bedroom and get that book back that he borrowed from me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now? You want me to go over there now?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do you know something?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you know something?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I might know something.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I might know something too.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s the thing you know?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no, I can’t tell you until you tell me what you know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t tell you what I know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well then I can’t tell you what I know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, fine.
(Silence ensues.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You don’t know!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, how about I go over there and I will walk into Chandler’s bedroom and I will see that thing that I think that I know is actually the thing that I think that I know! (Note: Kudos to Ms. Aniston on the delivery of that line. She said it very quickly and didn’t screw up a word. Try it yourself, it ain’t that easy.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: YOU KNOW!!!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: AND YOU KNOW!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I know!!!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler and Monica?!! Oh, this is unbelievable!! How long have you known?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Too long! Oh my God, Rach, I’ve been dying to talk to someone about this for so long! Listen, listen, we can’t say anything about this to anybody, they’re so weird about that! Listen… (Phoebe returns and interrupts them.)

content.speaker: Joey and Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! It’s raining. I don’t want to fly in the rain. So…
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I am going to go for a walk in the rain.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhh, yeah, me too.
(They both exit.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s weird. (Pause.) I bet they’re doing it.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe, Ross, and Monica are there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh good, okay, I can’t take it anymore. I can’t take it anymore. So you win, okay? Here! (Hands him the 50 bucks he’s about to owe him.) Pheebs? Flying a jet? Better make it a spaceship so that you can get back to your home planet! And Ross, phone call for you today, Tom Jones, he wants his pants back! And Hornswoggle? What are you dating a character from Fraggile Rock ?! (He sits down and sighs in relief.)
